result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas M Carroll

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Conference rescheduled to 11/17/2022 at 1:30 PM. Parties notified.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meijer.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Douglas M Carroll appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Douglas M Carroll.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Defense motions to challenge count 2, court denies the motion. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 09-07-2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.

Defendant Douglas M Carroll not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/7/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Douglas M Carroll not in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/10/20222@1:00pm
